events.originalText: Having already caused severe flooding in the Philippines, Typhoon Lekima made landfall in Zhejiang, China, and went on to become the costliest typhoon in Chinese history.
events.subtitle: Typhoon Lekima
events.headline: Typhoon Lekima Hits Zhejiang, China, Becomes Costliest in Chinese History

events.originalText: Jeffrey Epstein, an American financier and convicted sex offender, was found dead in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York.
events.subtitle: Jeffrey Epstein
events.headline: Financier and Sex Offender Jeffrey Epstein Found Dead in New York Cell

events.originalText: Amid large protests against the impending demolition of the Queen's Pier, in Hong Kong, the High Court dismissed legal attempts to preserve the landmark.
events.subtitle: Queen's Pier
events.headline: High Court Dismisses Legal Attempts to Preserve Queen's Pier in Hong Kong

events.originalText: The Civil Liberties Act of 1988 became law, authorizing reparations to surviving Japanese Americans interned during World War II.
events.subtitle: Civil Liberties Act of 1988
events.headline: Civil Liberties Act of 1988 Authorizes Reparations for Japanese Americans

events.originalText: The Civil Liberties Act of 1988 became law, authorizing reparations to surviving Japanese Americans interned during World War II.
events.subtitle: Civil Liberties Act of 1988
events.headline: Civil Liberties Act of 1988 Authorizes Reparations for Japanese Americans

events.originalText: The Heron Road Bridge in Ottawa, Canada, collapsed during its construction, killing nine workers.
events.subtitle: Heron Road Workers Memorial Bridge
events.headline: Heron Road Bridge in Ottawa Collapses, Killing Nine Workers

events.originalText: First Indochina War: The French Union withdrew its forces from Operation Camargue against the Việt Minh in central modern-day Vietnam.
events.subtitle: First Indochina War
events.headline: French Union Withdraws Forces from Operation Camargue in Vietnam

events.originalText: First Indochina War: The French Union withdrew its forces from Operation Camargue against the Việt Minh in central modern-day Vietnam.
events.subtitle: First Indochina War
events.headline: French Union Withdraws Forces from Operation Camargue in Vietnam

events.originalText: Russo-Japanese War: The first major confrontation between modern steel battleship fleets took place in the Battle of the Yellow Sea.
events.subtitle: Russo-Japanese War
events.headline: First Major Confrontation in Russo-Japanese War at Battle of Yellow Sea

events.originalText: The Amalgamated Association of Iron, Steel and Tin Workers began an ultimately unsuccessful strike to reverse its declining fortunes and organize large numbers of new members.
events.subtitle: Amalgamated Association of Iron and Steel Workers
events.headline: Amalgamated Association of Iron, Steel and Tin Workers Begin Strike

events.originalText: German chemist Felix Hoffmann discovered an improved method of synthesizing aspirin.
events.subtitle: Felix Hoffmann
events.headline: Chemist Felix Hoffmann Discovers Improved Method of Synthesizing Aspirin

events.originalText: José Antônio Saraiva announced that the Brazilian military would exact reprisals after Uruguay's governing Blanco Party refused Brazil's demands, beginning the Uruguayan War.
events.subtitle: José Antônio Saraiva
events.headline: Brazilian Military to Exact Reprisals in Uruguayan War

events.originalText: American Civil War: The first major battle west of the Mississippi River, the Battle of Wilson's Creek, was fought.
events.subtitle: American Civil War
events.headline: First Major Battle West of Mississippi River in American Civil War

events.originalText: From measurements of its motion, German astronomer Friedrich Bessel deduced that Sirius, the brightest star in the night sky, had an unseen companion (both pictured).
events.subtitle: Friedrich Bessel
events.headline: German Astronomer Friedrich Bessel Discovers Companion to Sirius

events.originalText: The Louvre (Louvre Pyramid pictured) in Paris, today the world's most visited museum, officially opened with an exhibition of 537 paintings and 184 objets d'art.
events.subtitle: Louvre
events.headline: Louvre in Paris Officially Opens as World's Most Visited Museum

events.originalText: The Louvre (pyramid pictured) in Paris, today the world's most-visited museum, opened with an exhibition of 537 paintings and 184 objets d'art.
events.subtitle: Louvre
events.headline: Louvre in Paris Opens with Exhibition of 537 Paintings and 184 Objets d'Art

events.originalText: French Revolution: Insurrectionists in Paris stormed the Tuileries Palace, effectively ending the French monarchy until it was restored in 1814.
events.subtitle: French Revolution
events.headline: Insurrectionists Storm Tuileries Palace in French Revolution

events.originalText: The first wave of the Expulsion of the Acadians from the present-day Canadian Maritime provinces by the British began with the Bay of Fundy campaign at Chignecto.
events.subtitle: Expulsion of the Acadians
events.headline: First Wave of Acadian Expulsion Begins in Canadian Maritime Provinces

events.originalText: The Swedish warship Vasa sank shortly after departing Stockholm on her maiden voyage to take part in the Thirty Years' War.
events.subtitle: Vasa (ship)
events.headline: Swedish Warship Vasa Sinks on Maiden Voyage to Thirty Years' War

events.originalText: Yekuno Amlak deposed the last Zagwe king and seized the imperial throne of Ethiopia, beginning the reign of the Solomonic dynasty, which would last for more than 700 years.
events.subtitle: Yekuno Amlak
events.headline: Yekuno Amlak Seizes Imperial Throne of Ethiopia, Starting Solomonic Dynasty

events.originalText: Yekuno Amlak deposed the last Zagwe king and seized the imperial throne of Ethiopia, beginning the reign of the Solomonic dynasty, which would last for more than 700 years.
events.subtitle: Yekuno Amlak
events.headline: Yekuno Amlak Seizes Imperial Throne of Ethiopia, Starting Solomonic Dynasty

events.originalText: Forces under Otto I were victorious at the Battle of Lechfeld near present-day Augsburg, Germany, holding off the incursions of the Magyars into Central Europe.
events.subtitle: Otto the Great
events.headline: Otto I Victorious at Battle of Lechfeld, Holding off Magyar Incursions
